isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Service Procedure

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: 1. Select Codefrom the menu bar, then view for the Diagnostic Trouble Code Window.
If the Electronic Control Module (ECM) detects Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs), they will be automatically displayed in the Diagnostic Trouble Code Window.

item.para: Active DTCS are detected during the current Key-On cycle.
Inactive DTCs were detected during earlier Key-On cycles.

svcproc.para: 2. To clear codes, open DTC window, select Code, and Clearfrom the drop-down menu bar.
Using the Engine Diagnostics switch to check Diagnostic Trouble Codes ( DTCs

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch ON. Do not start the engine. The ECM will begin the Output Circuit Check (self test). If DTCs are detected, the ECM will flash the WARN ENGINE light.

svcproc.para: When the self test is over, the ECM will flash the red OIL/WATER light and amber WARN ENGINE light to signal the Diagnostic Trouble Codes

note.para: All Diagnostic Trouble Codes are three digits. Code 111 indicates that no Diagnostic Trouble Codes have been detected. See form EGED-185-2 (Electronic Control System Diagnostics) for a complete listing of Diagnostic Trouble Codes.

step1.para: Count the flashes in sequence. After each digit of the code a short pause will occur.

item.para: Three flashes and a pause indicate number 3
Two flashes, a pause, three flashes, a pause, and two flashes and a pause indicate code 232.

step1.para: For more than one Diagnostic Trouble Code, the OIL/WATER light will flash once indicating the beginning of another active Diagnostic Trouble Code.

After all active Diagnostic Trouble Codes have flashed, the OIL/WATER light will flash twice to indicate the start of inactive Diagnostic Trouble Codes. Count the flashes from the WARN ENGINE light. If there is more than one inactive code, the OIL/WATER light will flash once in between each Diagnostic Trouble Code.
After all Diagnostic Trouble Codes have been sent, the OIL/WATER light will flash three times indicating end of message.
To repeat Diagnostic Trouble Code transmission, depress the Engine Diagnostic Switch. The ECM will resend stored Diagnostic Trouble Codes.
